To be fair the wall was already gone because my Sisters Husband smashed it down already but some little chunks were at the bottom so I helped with that and picked up a sledge hammer.

It was fun! Tho after my nap I woke up to horrible pain in my right hand.

topics.body:
Morning bastards.

I was just wondering that the Super Saiyan form, when shortened, is called SSJ.
So, what does the "J" stand for?
topics.author: 4fe1b9f47f123b13df002976

topics.body: Would any of you eat a Villager?
topics.author: 5446fcfc6368723ec21a0000

topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/553c2be46368720a05c30200#post_553c2be46368720a05c30200
i believe the original japanese name is spelled with a j and pronounced like "say-jin"

so yeah
topics.author: 500b587e7f123b1f230014a9

topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/553c2be46368720a05c30200#post_553c2be46368720a05c30200
In Japan the Saiyan race was actually called _Saiya-jin_. So anyone who went super would have been called _Supa Saiya-Jin_. Hence the SSJ.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff
